methods.name: initialize
methods.docs:
Initialize Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE). If it fails, BLE might be unavailable on this device.
On **Android** it will ask for the location permission. On **iOS** it will ask for the Bluetooth permission.
For an example, see [usage](#usage).

methods.name: isEnabled
methods.docs:
Reports whether Bluetooth is enabled on this device.
Always returns `true` on **web**.

methods.name: enable
methods.docs:
Enable Bluetooth.
Only available on **Android**.

methods.name: disable
methods.docs:
Disable Bluetooth.
Only available on **Android**.

methods.name: startEnabledNotifications

parameters.name: callback
parameters.docs: Callback function to use when the Bluetooth state changes.

tags.name: param
tags.text: callback Callback function to use when the Bluetooth state changes.

methods.docs:
Register a callback function that will be invoked when Bluetooth is enabled (true) or disabled (false) on this device.
Not available on **web** (the callback will never be invoked).

methods.name: stopEnabledNotifications
methods.docs: Stop the enabled notifications registered with `startEnabledNotifications`.

methods.name: isLocationEnabled
methods.docs:
Reports whether Location Services are enabled on this device.
Only available on **Android**.

methods.name: openLocationSettings
methods.docs:
Open Location settings.
Only available on **Android**.

methods.name: openBluetoothSettings
methods.docs:
Open Bluetooth settings.
Only available on **Android**.

methods.name: openAppSettings
methods.docs:
Open App settings.
Not available on **web**.
On **iOS** when a user declines the request to use Bluetooth on the first call of `initialize`, it is not possible
to request for Bluetooth again from within the app. In this case Bluetooth has to be enabled in the app settings
for the app to be able use it.

methods.name: setDisplayStrings

tags.name: param
tags.text: displayStrings

methods.docs: Set the strings that are displayed in the `requestDevice` dialog.

methods.name: requestDevice

parameters.name: options
parameters.docs: Device filters, see [RequestBleDeviceOptions](#RequestBleDeviceOptions)

tags.name: param
tags.text: options Device filters, see [RequestBleDeviceOptions](#RequestBleDeviceOptions)

methods.docs:
Request a peripheral BLE device to interact with. This will scan for available devices according to the filters in the options and show a dialog to pick a device.
For an example, see [usage](#usage).

methods.name: requestLEScan

tags.name: param
tags.text: options

tags.name: param
tags.text: callback

methods.docs:
Start scanning for BLE devices to interact with according to the filters in the options. The callback will be invoked on each device that is found.
Scanning will continue until `stopLEScan` is called. For an example, see [usage](#usage).
**NOTE**: Use with care on **web** platform, the required API is still behind a flag in most browsers.

methods.name: stopLEScan
methods.docs: Stop scanning for BLE devices. For an example, see [usage](#usage).

methods.name: getDevices

parameters.name: deviceIds
parameters.docs: List of device IDs, e.g. saved from a previous app run. No used on web.

tags.name: param
tags.text: deviceIds List of device IDs, e.g. saved from a previous app run. No used on web.

methods.docs:
On iOS and web, if you want to connect to a previously connected device without scanning first, you can use `getDevice`.
Uses [retrievePeripherals](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/corebluetooth/cbcentralmanager/1519127-retrieveperipherals) on iOS and
[getDevices](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Bluetooth/getDevices) on web.
On Android, you can directly connect to the device with the deviceId.

methods.name: getConnectedDevices

parameters.name: services
parameters.docs: List of services to filter the devices by. If no service is specified, no devices will be returned. Only applies to iOS.

tags.name: param
tags.text: services List of services to filter the devices by. If no service is specified, no devices will be returned. Only applies to iOS.

methods.docs:
Get a list of currently connected devices.
Uses [retrieveConnectedPeripherals](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/corebluetooth/cbcentralmanager/1518924-retrieveconnectedperipherals) on iOS,
[getConnectedDevices](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/bluetooth/BluetoothManager#getConnectedDevices(int)) on Android
and [getDevices](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Bluetooth/getDevices) on web.

methods.name: connect
methods.signature: (deviceId: string, onDisconnect?: ((deviceId: string) => void) | undefined, options?: TimeoutOptions | undefined) => Promise<void>

parameters.docs: The ID of the device to use (obtained from [requestDevice](#requestDevice) or [requestLEScan](#requestLEScan))

parameters.name: onDisconnect
parameters.docs: Optional disconnect callback function that will be used when the device disconnects

parameters.docs: Options for plugin call

methods.name: createBond

parameters.name: deviceId

tags.name: param
tags.text: deviceId The ID of the device to use (obtained from [requestDevice](#requestDevice) or [requestLEScan](#requestLEScan))

methods.docs:
Create a bond with a peripheral BLE device.
Only available on **Android**. On iOS bonding is handled by the OS.

methods.name: isBonded

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.docs: The ID of the device to use (obtained from [requestDevice](#requestDevice) or [requestLEScan](#requestLEScan))

tags.name: param
tags.text: deviceId The ID of the device to use (obtained from [requestDevice](#requestDevice) or [requestLEScan](#requestLEScan))

methods.docs:
Report whether a peripheral BLE device is bonded.
Only available on **Android**. On iOS bonding is handled by the OS.

methods.name: startNotifications
methods.signature: (deviceId: string, service: string, characteristic: string, callback: (value: DataView) => void) => Promise<void>

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.docs: The ID of the device to use (obtained from [requestDevice](#requestDevice) or [requestLEScan](#requestLEScan))

parameters.name: service
parameters.docs: UUID of the service (see [UUID format](#uuid-format))

parameters.name: characteristic
parameters.docs: UUID of the characteristic (see [UUID format](#uuid-format))

parameters.name: callback
parameters.docs: Callback function to use when the value of the characteristic changes

tags.name: param
tags.text: deviceId The ID of the device to use (obtained from [requestDevice](#requestDevice) or [requestLEScan](#requestLEScan))

tags.name: param
tags.text: service UUID of the service (see [UUID format](#uuid-format))

tags.name: param
tags.text: characteristic UUID of the characteristic (see [UUID format](#uuid-format))

tags.name: param
tags.text: callback Callback function to use when the value of the characteristic changes

methods.docs:
Start listening to changes of the value of a characteristic.
Note that you should only start the notifications once per characteristic in your app and share the data and
not call `startNotifications` in every component that needs the data.
For an example, see [usage](#usage).

methods.name: stopNotifications
methods.signature: (deviceId: string, service: string, characteristic: string) => Promise<void>

parameters.docs: UUID of the characteristic (see [UUID format](#uuid-format))

tags.name: param
tags.text: service UUID of the service (see [UUID format](#uuid-format))

tags.name: param
tags.text: characteristic UUID of the characteristic (see [UUID format](#uuid-format))

methods.docs: Stop listening to the changes of the value of a characteristic. For an example, see [usage](#usage).

properties.name: androidNeverForLocation

tags.text: false
tags.name: default

properties.docs:
If your app doesn't use Bluetooth scan results to derive physical
location information, you can strongly assert that your app
doesn't derive physical location. (Android only)
Requires adding 'neverForLocation' to AndroidManifest.xml
https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/connectivity/bluetooth/permissions#assert-never-for-location

tags.text: "Scanning..."
tags.name: default

tags.text: "Am Scannen..."
tags.name: example

tags.text: "Cancel"
tags.name: default

tags.text: "Abbrechen"
tags.name: example

tags.text: "Available devices"
tags.name: default

tags.text: "Verfügbare Geräte"
tags.name: example

tags.text: "No device found"
tags.name: default

tags.text: "Kein Gerät gefunden"
tags.name: example

properties.name: deviceId
properties.docs:
ID of the device, which will be needed for further calls.
On **Android** this is the BLE MAC address.
On **iOS** and **web** it is an identifier.

properties.name: name
properties.docs: Name of the peripheral device.

properties.name: services
properties.docs:
Filter devices by service UUIDs.
UUIDs have to be specified as 128 bit UUID strings,
e.g. ['0000180d-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb']
There is a helper function to convert numbers to UUIDs.
e.g. [numberToUUID(0x180f)]. (see [UUID format](#uuid-format))

properties.name: name
properties.docs: Filter devices by name

properties.name: namePrefix
properties.docs: Filter devices by name prefix

properties.name: optionalServices
properties.docs:
For **web**, all services that will be used have to be listed under services or optionalServices,
e.g. [numberToUUID(0x180f)] (see [UUID format](#uuid-format))

properties.name: allowDuplicates
properties.docs:
Normally scans will discard the second and subsequent advertisements from a single device.
If you need to receive them, set allowDuplicates to true (only applicable in `requestLEScan`).
(default: false)

properties.name: scanMode
properties.docs: Android scan mode (default: ScanMode.SCAN_MODE_BALANCED)

properties.name: device
properties.docs:
The peripheral device that was found in the scan.
**Android** and **web**: `device.name` is always identical to `localName`.
**iOS**: `device.name` is identical to `localName` the first time a device is discovered, but after connecting `device.name` is the cached GAP name in subsequent scans.

properties.name: localName
properties.docs: The name of the peripheral device from the advertisement data.

properties.name: rssi
properties.docs: Received Signal Strength Indication.

properties.name: txPower
properties.docs: Transmit power in dBm. A value of 127 indicates that it is not available.

properties.name: manufacturerData
properties.docs: Manufacturer data, key is a company identifier and value is the data.

properties.name: serviceData
properties.docs: Service data, key is a service UUID and value is the data.

properties.name: uuids
properties.docs: Advertised services.

properties.name: rawAdvertisement
properties.docs: Raw advertisement data (**Android** only).

methods.name: getFloat32

parameters.name: byteOffset
parameters.docs: The place in the buffer at which the value should be retrieved.

tags.name: param
tags.text: byteOffset The place in the buffer at which the value should be retrieved.

methods.docs:
Gets the Float32 value at the specified byte offset from the start of the view. There is
no alignment constraint; multi-byte values may be fetched from any offset.

interfaces.name: ArrayBuffer
interfaces.docs:
Represents a raw buffer of binary data, which is used to store data for the
different typed arrays. ArrayBuffers cannot be read from or written to directly,
but can be passed to a typed array or DataView Object to interpret the raw
buffer as needed.

methods.name: slice
methods.docs: Returns a section of an ArrayBuffer.

properties.name: byteLength
properties.docs: Read-only. The length of the ArrayBuffer (in bytes).

properties.name: timeout
properties.docs:
Timeout in milliseconds for plugin call.
Default is 10000 for `connect` and 5000 for other plugin methods.

members.name: SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER
members.docs:
Perform Bluetooth LE scan in low power mode. This mode is enforced if the scanning application is not in foreground.
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/bluetooth/le/ScanSettings#SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER

members.name: SCAN_MODE_BALANCED
members.docs:
Perform Bluetooth LE scan in balanced power mode. (default) Scan results are returned at a rate that provides a good trade-off between scan frequency and power consumption.
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/bluetooth/le/ScanSettings#SCAN_MODE_BALANCED

members.name: SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY
members.docs:
Scan using highest duty cycle. It's recommended to only use this mode when the application is running in the foreground.
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/bluetooth/le/ScanSettings#SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY

properties.name: displayStrings

tags.name: default
example

properties.docs: The strings that are displayed in the device selection dialog on iOS and Android when using `requestDevice()`.
